DevOps EngineerWe are hiring now !we have an openings for DevOps with 2 freshers + 1 Senior DevOps engineer requirement, majorly looking out with Azure & Shell scripting knowledge as priority.Kindly find the attached JD for your reference and let us know with the relevant profiles for the same.Job Summary :We are seeking a skilled and experienced DevOps Engineer to join our team. As a DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining the infrastructure and tools necessary to support our development and deployment processes. Your expertise in Azure, CI/CD, Jenkins, Ansible, system administration, shell scripting, Kubernetes, and Docker will be essential in ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of our software delivery pipeline.Responsibilities: Design, build, and maintain scalable and reliable infrastructure on Azure cloud platform. Implement and manage continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) processes to streamline software development and delivery. Utilize Jenkins to automate build, test, and deployment workflows. Develop and maintain Ansible playbooks for configuration management and infrastructure provisioning. Perform system administration tasks, including monitoring, troubleshooting, and optimizing system performance. Write shell scripts to automate routine tasks and enhance operational efficiency. Deploy, manage, and scale applications using Kubernetes and Docker containers. Collaborate with development teams to understand their requirements and provide guidance on infrastructure and deployment best practices. ğŸš€ Unlocking the Power of DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub & Terraform ğŸ”ğŸ”¥DevOps & SRE engineers are the backbone of modern IT operations. But how do tools like Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub, and Terraform fuel business success? More importantly, can we measure their ROI? Letâ€™s dive in! ğŸ’¡ğŸš€ Key Business Use Casesâœ… Docker: Enables containerization, ensuring consistent app deployment across environments. âœ… Kubernetes: Automates container orchestration, scaling, and management. âœ… GitHub: Enhances collaboration, version control, and CI/CD workflows. âœ… Terraform: Empowers infrastructure as code (IaC) for automated and repeatable deployments.ğŸ’¡ Importance for DevOps & SRE EngineersThese tools streamline workflows, improve reliability, and boost automation. They reduce human errors, enhance security, and ensure faster delivery cyclesâ€”essential for modern software development.ğŸ” Measuring ROI of DevOps Tools & Engineer EffortsHow do you justify the investment? Measure: âœ… Deployment Speed: Reduction in time-to-market. âœ… Incident Resolution Time: Faster recovery from failures. âœ… Operational Costs: Efficiency gains in cloud & infra spending. âœ… Security & Compliance: Improved governance and reduced vulnerabilities.ğŸ”¥ Lessons LearnedğŸ”¹ Adoption must be strategicâ€”rushing without proper governance can backfire. ğŸ”¹ Skill development is crucial; undertrained engineers can hinder adoption. ğŸ”¹ Continuous monitoring of tool effectiveness ensures long-term gains.ğŸ’° Business Benefits & Engineer ProductivityğŸš€ Faster go-to-market with CI/CD & automated deployments. ğŸ” Cost savings through optimized cloud usage. ğŸ’¡ Increased reliability with proactive monitoring & auto-healing infra. âœ… Higher developer efficiency with standardized workflows.ğŸŒ Cloud Agnostic or Cloud Dependent?Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub, and Terraform are largely cloud-agnostic ğŸŒ, but their implementation can be tailored for specific cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP). Engineers should prioritize multi-cloud strategies to avoid vendor lock-in.ğŸ“š Best Learning Resources & DocumentationDocker Documentation: https://docs.docker.comGitHub Documentation: https://docs.github.comTerraform Documentation: https://lnkd.in/dGp-UHPMKubernetes Documentation: https://kubernetes.io/docsEmbrace DevOps excellenceâ€”empower engineers, optimize tools, and drive measurable business impact! ğŸ’¡ğŸš€hashtag#DevOps hashtag#SRE hashtag#Kubernetes hashtag#Docker hashtag#GitHub hashtag#Terraform hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#Automation hashtag#InfrastructureAsCode

ğŸš€ Unlocking the Power of DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub & Terraform ğŸ”ğŸ”¥DevOps & SRE engineers are the backbone of modern IT operations. But how do tools like Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub, and Terraform fuel business success? More importantly, can we measure their ROI? Letâ€™s dive in! ğŸ’¡ğŸš€ Key Business Use Casesâœ… Docker: Enables containerization, ensuring consistent app deployment across environments. âœ… Kubernetes: Automates container orchestration, scaling, and management. âœ… GitHub: Enhances collaboration, version control, and CI/CD workflows. âœ… Terraform: Empowers infrastructure as code (IaC) for automated and repeatable deployments.ğŸ’¡ Importance for DevOps & SRE EngineersThese tools streamline workflows, improve reliability, and boost automation. They reduce human errors, enhance security, and ensure faster delivery cyclesâ€”essential for modern software development.ğŸ” Measuring ROI of DevOps Tools & Engineer EffortsHow do you justify the investment? Measure: âœ… Deployment Speed: Reduction in time-to-market. âœ… Incident Resolution Time: Faster recovery from failures. âœ… Operational Costs: Efficiency gains in cloud & infra spending. âœ… Security & Compliance: Improved governance and reduced vulnerabilities.ğŸ”¥ Lessons LearnedğŸ”¹ Adoption must be strategicâ€”rushing without proper governance can backfire. ğŸ”¹ Skill development is crucial; undertrained engineers can hinder adoption. ğŸ”¹ Continuous monitoring of tool effectiveness ensures long-term gains.ğŸ’° Business Benefits & Engineer ProductivityğŸš€ Faster go-to-market with CI/CD & automated deployments. ğŸ” Cost savings through optimized cloud usage. ğŸ’¡ Increased reliability with proactive monitoring & auto-healing infra. âœ… Higher developer efficiency with standardized workflows.ğŸŒ Cloud Agnostic or Cloud Dependent?Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub, and Terraform are largely cloud-agnostic ğŸŒ, but their implementation can be tailored for specific cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP). Engineers should prioritize multi-cloud strategies to avoid vendor lock-in.ğŸ“š Best Learning Resources & DocumentationDocker Documentation: https://docs.docker.comGitHub Documentation: https://docs.github.comTerraform Documentation: https://lnkd.in/dGp-UHPMKubernetes Documentation: https://kubernetes.io/docsEmbrace DevOps excellenceâ€”empower engineers, optimize tools, and drive measurable business impact! ğŸ’¡ğŸš€hashtag#DevOps hashtag#SRE hashtag#Kubernetes hashtag#Docker hashtag#GitHub hashtag#Terraform hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#Automation hashtag#InfrastructureAsCode

ğŸš€ Unlocking the Power of DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub & Terraform ğŸ”ğŸ”¥DevOps & SRE engineers are the backbone of modern IT operations. But how do tools like Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub, and Terraform fuel business success? More importantly, can we measure their ROI? Letâ€™s dive in! ğŸ’¡ğŸš€ Key Business Use Casesâœ… Docker: Enables containerization, ensuring consistent app deployment across environments. âœ… Kubernetes: Automates container orchestration, scaling, and management. âœ… GitHub: Enhances collaboration, version control, and CI/CD workflows. âœ… Terraform: Empowers infrastructure as code (IaC) for automated and repeatable deployments.ğŸ’¡ Importance for DevOps & SRE EngineersThese tools streamline workflows, improve reliability, and boost automation. They reduce human errors, enhance security, and ensure faster delivery cyclesâ€”essential for modern software development.ğŸ” Measuring ROI of DevOps Tools & Engineer EffortsHow do you justify the investment? Measure: âœ… Deployment Speed: Reduction in time-to-market. âœ… Incident Resolution Time: Faster recovery from failures. âœ… Operational Costs: Efficiency gains in cloud & infra spending. âœ… Security & Compliance: Improved governance and reduced vulnerabilities.ğŸ”¥ Lessons LearnedğŸ”¹ Adoption must be strategicâ€”rushing without proper governance can backfire. ğŸ”¹ Skill development is crucial; undertrained engineers can hinder adoption. ğŸ”¹ Continuous monitoring of tool effectiveness ensures long-term gains.ğŸ’° Business Benefits & Engineer ProductivityğŸš€ Faster go-to-market with CI/CD & automated deployments. ğŸ” Cost savings through optimized cloud usage. ğŸ’¡ Increased reliability with proactive monitoring & auto-healing infra. âœ… Higher developer efficiency with standardized workflows.ğŸŒ Cloud Agnostic or Cloud Dependent?Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub, and Terraform are largely cloud-agnostic ğŸŒ, but their implementation can be tailored for specific cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP). Engineers should prioritize multi-cloud strategies to avoid vendor lock-in.ğŸ“š Best Learning Resources & DocumentationDocker Documentation: https://docs.docker.comGitHub Documentation: https://docs.github.comTerraform Documentation: https://lnkd.in/dGp-UHPMKubernetes Documentation: https://kubernetes.io/docsEmbrace DevOps excellenceâ€”empower engineers, optimize tools, and drive measurable business impact! ğŸ’¡ğŸš€hashtag#DevOps hashtag#SRE hashtag#Kubernetes hashtag#Docker hashtag#GitHub hashtag#Terraform hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#Automation hashtag#InfrastructureAsCode

Title: Transform Your Software Delivery with DevOps AutomationAre you looking to streamline your development process, reduce risk, and ship software faster? DevOps automation can accelerate your release cycle and free you up to focus on the strategic parts of your job. Letâ€™s explore the details, the practical â€œhow-to,â€ the pros and cons, and some ideas for continuous improvement.1. What Is DevOps Automation? DevOps automation involves using scripts and specialized tools to handle repetitive tasksâ€”such as code integration, testing, and deploymentâ€”so that your team can focus on more complex, value-added work. From CI/CD pipelines to infrastructure-as-code, automating these pieces helps create a reliable and scalable process.2. How to Implement DevOps Automation â€¢ Choose Your Tools: Pick a CI/CD tool like Jenkins, GitLab CI, or GitHub Actions based on your teamâ€™s familiarity and project requirements. â€¢ Containerize Applications: Use Docker or Kubernetes to standardize environments, making deployments and rollbacks consistent. â€¢ Automate Tests: Integrate unit, integration, and end-to-end tests into your pipeline to catch issues early. â€¢ Infrastructure-as-Code: Manage your infrastructure through tools such as Terraform or AWS CloudFormation for repeatable provisioning. â€¢ Monitoring & Alerting: Leverage solutions like Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog, or New Relic to receive real-time insights into application performance and automate the escalation process for issues.3. Pros & Cons of DevOps Automation â€¢ Pros:  â€“ Faster Time to Market: Automated pipelines support rapid releases, helping you deliver new features to customers sooner.  â€“ Reduced Human Error: Scripts and standardized processes minimize manual mistakes and misconfigurations.  â€“ Consistency & Reliability: Reproducible builds and deployments maintain consistent environments across staging and production. â€¢ Cons:  â€“ Initial Setup Complexity: Building automated pipelines requires time, expertise, and alignment on tools and standards.  â€“ Maintenance Overhead: Automation scripts and pipelines need continuous upkeep to accommodate new code, dependencies, and security patches.  â€“ Skill Gaps: Not all team members may be familiar with automation tools; training or hiring specialized talent might be needed.4. Tips for Continuous Improvement â€¢ Review & Update Pipelines: Regularly revisit your pipeline configurations to remove outdated scripts or add new integrations. â€¢ Shift Security Left: Integrate security scans early in the pipeline to detect vulnerabilities before they reach production. â€¢ Embrace Observability: Track key metrics

But how do tools like Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub, and Terraform fuel business success? More importantly, can we measure their ROI? Letâ€™s dive in! ğŸ’¡ğŸš€ Key Business Use Casesâœ… Docker: Enables containerization, ensuring consistent app deployment across environments. âœ… Kubernetes: Automates container orchestration, scaling, and management. âœ… GitHub: Enhances collaboration, version control, and CI/CD workflows. âœ… Terraform: Empowers infrastructure as code (IaC) for automated and repeatable deployments.ğŸ’¡ Importance for DevOps & SRE EngineersThese tools streamline workflows, improve reliability, and boost automation. They reduce human errors, enhance security, and ensure faster delivery cyclesâ€”essential for modern software development.ğŸ” Measuring ROI of DevOps Tools & Engineer EffortsHow do you justify the investment? Measure: âœ… Deployment Speed: Reduction in time-to-market. âœ… Incident Resolution Time: Faster recovery from failures. âœ… Operational Costs: Efficiency gains in cloud & infra spending. âœ… Security & Compliance: Improved governance and reduced vulnerabilities.ğŸ”¥ Lessons LearnedğŸ”¹ Adoption must be strategicâ€”rushing without proper governance can backfire. ğŸ”¹ Skill development is crucial; undertrained engineers can hinder adoption. ğŸ”¹ Continuous monitoring of tool effectiveness ensures long-term gains.ğŸ’° Business Benefits & Engineer ProductivityğŸš€ Faster go-to-market with CI/CD & automated deployments. ğŸ” Cost savings through optimized cloud usage. ğŸ’¡ Increased reliability with proactive monitoring & auto-healing infra. âœ… Higher developer efficiency with standardized workflows.ğŸŒ Cloud Agnostic or Cloud Dependent?Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub, and Terraform are largely cloud-agnostic ğŸŒ, but their implementation can be tailored for specific cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP). Title: Transform Your Software Delivery with DevOps AutomationAre you looking to streamline your development process, reduce risk, and ship software faster? DevOps automation can accelerate your release cycle and free you up to focus on the strategic parts of your job. Letâ€™s explore the details, the practical â€œhow-to,â€ the pros and cons, and some ideas for continuous improvement.1. What Is DevOps Automation? DevOps automation involves using scripts and specialized tools to handle repetitive tasksâ€”such as code integration, testing, and deploymentâ€”so that your team can focus on more complex, value-added work. From CI/CD pipelines to infrastructure-as-code, automating these pieces helps create a reliable and scalable process.2. How to Implement DevOps Automation â€¢ Choose Your Tools: Pick a CI/CD tool like Jenkins, GitLab CI, or GitHub Actions based on your teamâ€™s familiarity and project requirements. â€¢ Containerize Applications: Use Docker or Kubernetes to standardize environments, making deployments and rollbacks consistent. â€¢ Automate Tests: Integrate unit, integration, and end-to-end tests into your pipeline to catch issues early. â€¢ Infrastructure-as-Code: Manage your infrastructure through tools such as Terraform or AWS CloudFormation for repeatable provisioning. â€¢ Monitoring & Alerting: Leverage solutions like Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog, or New Relic to receive real-time insights into application performance and automate the escalation process for issues.3. Pros & Cons of DevOps Automation â€¢ Pros:  â€“ Faster Time to Market: Automated pipelines support rapid releases, helping you deliver new features to customers sooner.  â€“ Reduced Human Error: Scripts and standardized processes minimize manual mistakes and misconfigurations.  â€“ Consistency & Reliability: Reproducible builds and deployments maintain consistent environments across staging and production. â€¢ Cons:  â€“ Initial Setup Complexity: Building automated pipelines requires time, expertise, and alignment on tools and standards.  â€“ Maintenance Overhead: Automation scripts and pipelines need continuous upkeep to accommodate new code, dependencies, and security patches.  â€“ Skill Gaps: Not all team members may be familiar with automation tools; training or hiring specialized talent might be needed.4. Tips for Continuous Improvement â€¢ Review & Update Pipelines: Regularly revisit your pipeline configurations to remove outdated scripts or add new integrations. â€¢ Shift Security Left: Integrate security scans early in the pipeline to detect vulnerabilities before they reach production. â€¢ Embrace Observability: Track key metrics

Title: Transform Your Software Delivery with DevOps AutomationAre you looking to streamline your development process, reduce risk, and ship software faster? DevOps automation can accelerate your release cycle and free you up to focus on the strategic parts of your job. Letâ€™s explore the details, the practical â€œhow-to,â€ the pros and cons, and some ideas for continuous improvement.1. What Is DevOps Automation? DevOps automation involves using scripts and specialized tools to handle repetitive tasksâ€”such as code integration, testing, and deploymentâ€”so that your team can focus on more complex, value-added work. From CI/CD pipelines to infrastructure-as-code, automating these pieces helps create a reliable and scalable process.2. How to Implement DevOps Automation â€¢ Choose Your Tools: Pick a CI/CD tool like Jenkins, GitLab CI, or GitHub Actions based on your teamâ€™s familiarity and project requirements. â€¢ Containerize Applications: Use Docker or Kubernetes to standardize environments, making deployments and rollbacks consistent. â€¢ Automate Tests: Integrate unit, integration, and end-to-end tests into your pipeline to catch issues early. â€¢ Infrastructure-as-Code: Manage your infrastructure through tools such as Terraform or AWS CloudFormation for repeatable provisioning. â€¢ Monitoring & Alerting: Leverage solutions like Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog, or New Relic to receive real-time insights into application performance and automate the escalation process for issues.3. Pros & Cons of DevOps Automation â€¢ Pros:  â€“ Faster Time to Market: Automated pipelines support rapid releases, helping you deliver new features to customers sooner.  â€“ Reduced Human Error: Scripts and standardized processes minimize manual mistakes and misconfigurations.  â€“ Consistency & Reliability: Reproducible builds and deployments maintain consistent environments across staging and production. â€¢ Cons:  â€“ Initial Setup Complexity: Building automated pipelines requires time, expertise, and alignment on tools and standards.  â€“ Maintenance Overhead: Automation scripts and pipelines need continuous upkeep to accommodate new code, dependencies, and security patches.  â€“ Skill Gaps: Not all team members may be familiar with automation tools; training or hiring specialized talent might be needed.4. Tips for Continuous Improvement â€¢ Review & Update Pipelines: Regularly revisit your pipeline configurations to remove outdated scripts or add new integrations. â€¢ Shift Security Left: Integrate security scans early in the pipeline to detect vulnerabilities before they reach production. â€¢ Embrace Observability: Track key metrics

Title: Transform Your Software Delivery with DevOps AutomationAre you looking to streamline your development process, reduce risk, and ship software faster? DevOps automation can accelerate your release cycle and free you up to focus on the strategic parts of your job. Letâ€™s explore the details, the practical â€œhow-to,â€ the pros and cons, and some ideas for continuous improvement.1. What Is DevOps Automation? DevOps automation involves using scripts and specialized tools to handle repetitive tasksâ€”such as code integration, testing, and deploymentâ€”so that your team can focus on more complex, value-added work. From CI/CD pipelines to infrastructure-as-code, automating these pieces helps create a reliable and scalable process.2. How to Implement DevOps Automation â€¢ Choose Your Tools: Pick a CI/CD tool like Jenkins, GitLab CI, or GitHub Actions based on your teamâ€™s familiarity and project requirements. â€¢ Containerize Applications: Use Docker or Kubernetes to standardize environments, making deployments and rollbacks consistent. â€¢ Automate Tests: Integrate unit, integration, and end-to-end tests into your pipeline to catch issues early. â€¢ Infrastructure-as-Code: Manage your infrastructure through tools such as Terraform or AWS CloudFormation for repeatable provisioning. â€¢ Monitoring & Alerting: Leverage solutions like Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog, or New Relic to receive real-time insights into application performance and automate the escalation process for issues.3. Pros & Cons of DevOps Automation â€¢ Pros:  â€“ Faster Time to Market: Automated pipelines support rapid releases, helping you deliver new features to customers sooner.  â€“ Reduced Human Error: Scripts and standardized processes minimize manual mistakes and misconfigurations.  â€“ Consistency & Reliability: Reproducible builds and deployments maintain consistent environments across staging and production. â€¢ Cons:  â€“ Initial Setup Complexity: Building automated pipelines requires time, expertise, and alignment on tools and standards.  â€“ Maintenance Overhead: Automation scripts and pipelines need continuous upkeep to accommodate new code, dependencies, and security patches.  â€“ Skill Gaps: Not all team members may be familiar with automation tools; training or hiring specialized talent might be needed.4. Tips for Continuous Improvement â€¢ Review & Update Pipelines: Regularly revisit your pipeline configurations to remove outdated scripts or add new integrations. â€¢ Shift Security Left: Integrate security scans early in the pipeline to detect vulnerabilities before they reach production. â€¢ Embrace Observability: Track key metrics

Title: Transform Your Software Delivery with DevOps AutomationAre you looking to streamline your development process, reduce risk, and ship software faster? DevOps automation can accelerate your release cycle and free you up to focus on the strategic parts of your job. Letâ€™s explore the details, the practical â€œhow-to,â€ the pros and cons, and some ideas for continuous improvement.1. What Is DevOps Automation? DevOps automation involves using scripts and specialized tools to handle repetitive tasksâ€”such as code integration, testing, and deploymentâ€”so that your team can focus on more complex, value-added work. From CI/CD pipelines to infrastructure-as-code, automating these pieces helps create a reliable and scalable process.2. How to Implement DevOps Automation â€¢ Choose Your Tools: Pick a CI/CD tool like Jenkins, GitLab CI, or GitHub Actions based on your teamâ€™s familiarity and project requirements. â€¢ Containerize Applications: Use Docker or Kubernetes to standardize environments, making deployments and rollbacks consistent. â€¢ Automate Tests: Integrate unit, integration, and end-to-end tests into your pipeline to catch issues early. â€¢ Infrastructure-as-Code: Manage your infrastructure through tools such as Terraform or AWS CloudFormation for repeatable provisioning. â€¢ Monitoring & Alerting: Leverage solutions like Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog, or New Relic to receive real-time insights into application performance and automate the escalation process for issues.3. Pros & Cons of DevOps Automation â€¢ Pros:  â€“ Faster Time to Market: Automated pipelines support rapid releases, helping you deliver new features to customers sooner.  â€“ Reduced Human Error: Scripts and standardized processes minimize manual mistakes and misconfigurations.  â€“ Consistency & Reliability: Reproducible builds and deployments maintain consistent environments across staging and production. â€¢ Cons:  â€“ Initial Setup Complexity: Building automated pipelines requires time, expertise, and alignment on tools and standards.  â€“ Maintenance Overhead: Automation scripts and pipelines need continuous upkeep to accommodate new code, dependencies, and security patches.  â€“ Skill Gaps: Not all team members may be familiar with automation tools; training or hiring specialized talent might be needed.4. Tips for Continuous Improvement â€¢ Review & Update Pipelines: Regularly revisit your pipeline configurations to remove outdated scripts or add new integrations. â€¢ Shift Security Left: Integrate security scans early in the pipeline to detect vulnerabilities before they reach production. â€¢ Embrace Observability: Track key metrics

Day16-16MarchFortune Cloud Technologies Private Limited ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ What is Devops ?---DevOps is a combination of "Development" and "Operations." It's a set of practices, tools, and cultural philosophies aimed at improving the collaboration and communication between software development (Dev) and IT operations (Ops). The goal is to automate and streamline the process of building, testing, releasing, and managing software to deliver faster, more reliable updates and improvements.ğŸ¯ Key Goals of DevOps:âœ… Faster delivery â€“ Automating processes to shorten the software development lifecycle. âœ… Higher quality â€“ Reducing bugs and improving software reliability. âœ… Better collaboration â€“ Breaking down silos between developers and operations teams. âœ… Increased automation â€“ Automating repetitive tasks to reduce errors and increase efficiency. âœ… Continuous improvement â€“ Using feedback to improve processes and products.ğŸŒ Why DevOps Matters1. Faster Delivery: Continuous deployment means you can release code multiple times a day.2. Improved Quality: Automated testing and monitoring catch bugs early.3 .Better Team Collaboration: No more blaming between development and operations teams.4. Cost Reduction: Automation reduces manual effort and human error.5. Scalability: Infrastructure as Code (IaC) allows for rapid scaling.ğŸš€ DevOps Life Cycle (Short Summary)The DevOps lifecycle includes 8 key stages that form a continuous loop:1ï¸âƒ£ Plan â€“ Define project requirements and goals.2ï¸âƒ£ Develop â€“ Write and manage code using version control.3ï¸âƒ£ Build â€“ Compile and package the code.4ï¸âƒ£ Test â€“ Run automated tests to check for bugs and errors.5ï¸âƒ£ Release â€“ Prepare and approve code for deployment.6ï¸âƒ£ Deploy â€“ Automate code deployment to production.7ï¸âƒ£ Operate â€“ Manage and monitor applications and infrastructure.8ï¸âƒ£ Monitor â€“ Continuously track performance and issues.DevOps = Faster Releases + Better Quality + Happier Teams ğŸ˜Fortune Cloud Technologies Private Limitedhashtag#devops hashtag#aws hashtag#docker hashtag#kubernets hashtag#jenkins hashtag#cloud hashtag#tools hashtag#fortunecloud

Title: Transform Your Software Delivery with DevOps AutomationAre you looking to streamline your development process, reduce risk, and ship software faster? DevOps automation can accelerate your release cycle and free you up to focus on the strategic parts of your job. Letâ€™s explore the details, the practical â€œhow-to,â€ the pros and cons, and some ideas for continuous improvement.1. What Is DevOps Automation? DevOps automation involves using scripts and specialized tools to handle repetitive tasksâ€”such as code integration, testing, and deploymentâ€”so that your team can focus on more complex, value-added work. From CI/CD pipelines to infrastructure-as-code, automating these pieces helps create a reliable and scalable process.2. How to Implement DevOps Automation â€¢ Choose Your Tools: Pick a CI/CD tool like Jenkins, GitLab CI, or GitHub Actions based on your teamâ€™s familiarity and project requirements. â€¢ Containerize Applications: Use Docker or Kubernetes to standardize environments, making deployments and rollbacks consistent. â€¢ Automate Tests: Integrate unit, integration, and end-to-end tests into your pipeline to catch issues early. â€¢ Infrastructure-as-Code: Manage your infrastructure through tools such as Terraform or AWS CloudFormation for repeatable provisioning. â€¢ Monitoring & Alerting: Leverage solutions like Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog, or New Relic to receive real-time insights into application performance and automate the escalation process for issues.3. Pros & Cons of DevOps Automation â€¢ Pros:  â€“ Faster Time to Market: Automated pipelines support rapid releases, helping you deliver new features to customers sooner.  â€“ Reduced Human Error: Scripts and standardized processes minimize manual mistakes and misconfigurations.  â€“ Consistency & Reliability: Reproducible builds and deployments maintain consistent environments across staging and production. â€¢ Cons:  â€“ Initial Setup Complexity: Building automated pipelines requires time, expertise, and alignment on tools and standards.  â€“ Maintenance Overhead: Automation scripts and pipelines need continuous upkeep to accommodate new code, dependencies, and security patches.  â€“ Skill Gaps: Not all team members may be familiar with automation tools; training or hiring specialized talent might be needed.4. Tips for Continuous Improvement â€¢ Review & Update Pipelines: Regularly revisit your pipeline configurations to remove outdated scripts or add new integrations. â€¢ Shift Security Left: Integrate security scans early in the pipeline to detect vulnerabilities before they reach production. â€¢ Embrace Observability: Track key metrics

Day16-16MarchFortune Cloud Technologies Private Limited ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ What is Devops ?---DevOps is a combination of "Development" and "Operations." It's a set of practices, tools, and cultural philosophies aimed at improving the collaboration and communication between software development (Dev) and IT operations (Ops). The goal is to automate and streamline the process of building, testing, releasing, and managing software to deliver faster, more reliable updates and improvements.ğŸ¯ Key Goals of DevOps:âœ… Faster delivery â€“ Automating processes to shorten the software development lifecycle. âœ… Higher quality â€“ Reducing bugs and improving software reliability. âœ… Better collaboration â€“ Breaking down silos between developers and operations teams. âœ… Increased automation â€“ Automating repetitive tasks to reduce errors and increase efficiency. âœ… Continuous improvement â€“ Using feedback to improve processes and products.ğŸŒ Why DevOps Matters1. Faster Delivery: Continuous deployment means you can release code multiple times a day.2. Improved Quality: Automated testing and monitoring catch bugs early.3 .Better Team Collaboration: No more blaming between development and operations teams.4. Cost Reduction: Automation reduces manual effort and human error.5. Scalability: Infrastructure as Code (IaC) allows for rapid scaling.ğŸš€ DevOps Life Cycle (Short Summary)The DevOps lifecycle includes 8 key stages that form a continuous loop:1ï¸âƒ£ Plan â€“ Define project requirements and goals.2ï¸âƒ£ Develop â€“ Write and manage code using version control.3ï¸âƒ£ Build â€“ Compile and package the code.4ï¸âƒ£ Test â€“ Run automated tests to check for bugs and errors.5ï¸âƒ£ Release â€“ Prepare and approve code for deployment.6ï¸âƒ£ Deploy â€“ Automate code deployment to production.7ï¸âƒ£ Operate â€“ Manage and monitor applications and infrastructure.8ï¸âƒ£ Monitor â€“ Continuously track performance and issues.DevOps = Faster Releases + Better Quality + Happier Teams ğŸ˜Fortune Cloud Technologies Private Limitedhashtag#devops hashtag#aws hashtag#docker hashtag#kubernets hashtag#jenkins hashtag#cloud hashtag#tools hashtag#fortunecloud

Title: Transform Your Software Delivery with DevOps AutomationAre you looking to streamline your development process, reduce risk, and ship software faster? DevOps automation can accelerate your release cycle and free you up to focus on the strategic parts of your job. Letâ€™s explore the details, the practical â€œhow-to,â€ the pros and cons, and some ideas for continuous improvement.1. What Is DevOps Automation? DevOps automation involves using scripts and specialized tools to handle repetitive tasksâ€”such as code integration, testing, and deploymentâ€”so that your team can focus on more complex, value-added work. From CI/CD pipelines to infrastructure-as-code, automating these pieces helps create a reliable and scalable process.2. How to Implement DevOps Automation â€¢ Choose Your Tools: Pick a CI/CD tool like Jenkins, GitLab CI, or GitHub Actions based on your teamâ€™s familiarity and project requirements. â€¢ Containerize Applications: Use Docker or Kubernetes to standardize environments, making deployments and rollbacks consistent. â€¢ Automate Tests: Integrate unit, integration, and end-to-end tests into your pipeline to catch issues early. â€¢ Infrastructure-as-Code: Manage your infrastructure through tools such as Terraform or AWS CloudFormation for repeatable provisioning. â€¢ Monitoring & Alerting: Leverage solutions like Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog, or New Relic to receive real-time insights into application performance and automate the escalation process for issues.3. Pros & Cons of DevOps Automation â€¢ Pros:  â€“ Faster Time to Market: Automated pipelines support rapid releases, helping you deliver new features to customers sooner.  â€“ Reduced Human Error: Scripts and standardized processes minimize manual mistakes and misconfigurations.  â€“ Consistency & Reliability: Reproducible builds and deployments maintain consistent environments across staging and production. â€¢ Cons:  â€“ Initial Setup Complexity: Building automated pipelines requires time, expertise, and alignment on tools and standards.  â€“ Maintenance Overhead: Automation scripts and pipelines need continuous upkeep to accommodate new code, dependencies, and security patches.  â€“ Skill Gaps: Not all team members may be familiar with automation tools; training or hiring specialized talent might be needed.4. Tips for Continuous Improvement â€¢ Review & Update Pipelines: Regularly revisit your pipeline configurations to remove outdated scripts or add new integrations. â€¢ Shift Security Left: Integrate security scans early in the pipeline to detect vulnerabilities before they reach production. â€¢ Embrace Observability: Track key metrics

Day16-16MarchFortune Cloud Technologies Private Limited ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ What is Devops ?---DevOps is a combination of "Development" and "Operations." It's a set of practices, tools, and cultural philosophies aimed at improving the collaboration and communication between software development (Dev) and IT operations (Ops). The goal is to automate and streamline the process of building, testing, releasing, and managing software to deliver faster, more reliable updates and improvements.ğŸ¯ Key Goals of DevOps:âœ… Faster delivery â€“ Automating processes to shorten the software development lifecycle. âœ… Higher quality â€“ Reducing bugs and improving software reliability. âœ… Better collaboration â€“ Breaking down silos between developers and operations teams. âœ… Increased automation â€“ Automating repetitive tasks to reduce errors and increase efficiency. âœ… Continuous improvement â€“ Using feedback to improve processes and products.ğŸŒ Why DevOps Matters1. Faster Delivery: Continuous deployment means you can release code multiple times a day.2. Improved Quality: Automated testing and monitoring catch bugs early.3 .Better Team Collaboration: No more blaming between development and operations teams.4. Cost Reduction: Automation reduces manual effort and human error.5. Scalability: Infrastructure as Code (IaC) allows for rapid scaling.ğŸš€ DevOps Life Cycle (Short Summary)The DevOps lifecycle includes 8 key stages that form a continuous loop:1ï¸âƒ£ Plan â€“ Define project requirements and goals.2ï¸âƒ£ Develop â€“ Write and manage code using version control.3ï¸âƒ£ Build â€“ Compile and package the code.4ï¸âƒ£ Test â€“ Run automated tests to check for bugs and errors.5ï¸âƒ£ Release â€“ Prepare and approve code for deployment.6ï¸âƒ£ Deploy â€“ Automate code deployment to production.7ï¸âƒ£ Operate â€“ Manage and monitor applications and infrastructure.8ï¸âƒ£ Monitor â€“ Continuously track performance and issues.DevOps = Faster Releases + Better Quality + Happier Teams ğŸ˜Fortune Cloud Technologies Private Limitedhashtag#devops hashtag#aws hashtag#docker hashtag#kubernets hashtag#jenkins hashtag#cloud hashtag#tools hashtag#fortunecloud

DevOps EngineerWe are hiring now !we have an openings for DevOps with 2 freshers + 1 Senior DevOps engineer requirement, majorly looking out with Azure & Shell scripting knowledge as priority.Kindly find the attached JD for your reference and let us know with the relevant profiles for the same.Job Summary :We are seeking a skilled and experienced DevOps Engineer to join our team. As a DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining the infrastructure and tools necessary to support our development and deployment processes. Your expertise in Azure, CI/CD, Jenkins, Ansible, system administration, shell scripting, Kubernetes, and Docker will be essential in ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of our software delivery pipeline.Responsibilities: Design, build, and maintain scalable and reliable infrastructure on Azure cloud platform. Implement and manage continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) processes to streamline software development and delivery. Utilize Jenkins to automate build, test, and deployment workflows. Develop and maintain Ansible playbooks for configuration management and infrastructure provisioning. Perform system administration tasks, including monitoring, troubleshooting, and optimizing system performance. Write shell scripts to automate routine tasks and enhance operational efficiency. Deploy, manage, and scale applications using Kubernetes and Docker containers. Collaborate with development teams to understand their requirements and provide guidance on infrastructure and deployment best practices. ğŸš€ Unlocking the Power of DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub & Terraform ğŸ”ğŸ”¥DevOps & SRE engineers are the backbone of modern IT operations. But how do tools like Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub, and Terraform fuel business success? More importantly, can we measure their ROI? Letâ€™s dive in! ğŸ’¡ğŸš€ Key Business Use Casesâœ… Docker: Enables containerization, ensuring consistent app deployment across environments. âœ… Kubernetes: Automates container orchestration, scaling, and management. âœ… GitHub: Enhances collaboration, version control, and CI/CD workflows. âœ… Terraform: Empowers infrastructure as code (IaC) for automated and repeatable deployments.ğŸ’¡ Importance for DevOps & SRE EngineersThese tools streamline workflows, improve reliability, and boost automation. They reduce human errors, enhance security, and ensure faster delivery cyclesâ€”essential for modern software development.ğŸ” Measuring ROI of DevOps Tools & Engineer EffortsHow do you justify the investment? Measure: âœ… Deployment Speed: Reduction in time-to-market. âœ… Incident Resolution Time: Faster recovery from failures. âœ… Operational Costs: Efficiency gains in cloud & infra spending. âœ… Security & Compliance: Improved governance and reduced vulnerabilities.ğŸ”¥ Lessons LearnedğŸ”¹ Adoption must be strategicâ€”rushing without proper governance can backfire. ğŸ”¹ Skill development is crucial; undertrained engineers can hinder adoption. ğŸ”¹ Continuous monitoring of tool effectiveness ensures long-term gains.ğŸ’° Business Benefits & Engineer ProductivityğŸš€ Faster go-to-market with CI/CD & automated deployments. ğŸ” Cost savings through optimized cloud usage. ğŸ’¡ Increased reliability with proactive monitoring & auto-healing infra. âœ… Higher developer efficiency with standardized workflows.ğŸŒ Cloud Agnostic or Cloud Dependent?Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub, and Terraform are largely cloud-agnostic ğŸŒ, but their implementation can be tailored for specific cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP). Engineers should prioritize multi-cloud strategies to avoid vendor lock-in.ğŸ“š Best Learning Resources & DocumentationDocker Documentation: https://docs.docker.comGitHub Documentation: https://docs.github.comTerraform Documentation: https://lnkd.in/dGp-UHPMKubernetes Documentation: https://kubernetes.io/docsEmbrace DevOps excellenceâ€”empower engineers, optimize tools, and drive measurable business impact! ğŸ’¡ğŸš€hashtag#DevOps hashtag#SRE hashtag#Kubernetes hashtag#Docker hashtag#GitHub hashtag#Terraform hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#Automation hashtag#InfrastructureAsCode

Title: Transform Your Software Delivery with DevOps AutomationAre you looking to streamline your development process, reduce risk, and ship software faster? DevOps automation can accelerate your release cycle and free you up to focus on the strategic parts of your job. Letâ€™s explore the details, the practical â€œhow-to,â€ the pros and cons, and some ideas for continuous improvement.1. What Is DevOps Automation? DevOps automation involves using scripts and specialized tools to handle repetitive tasksâ€”such as code integration, testing, and deploymentâ€”so that your team can focus on more complex, value-added work. From CI/CD pipelines to infrastructure-as-code, automating these pieces helps create a reliable and scalable process.2. How to Implement DevOps Automation â€¢ Choose Your Tools: Pick a CI/CD tool like Jenkins, GitLab CI, or GitHub Actions based on your teamâ€™s familiarity and project requirements. â€¢ Containerize Applications: Use Docker or Kubernetes to standardize environments, making deployments and rollbacks consistent. â€¢ Automate Tests: Integrate unit, integration, and end-to-end tests into your pipeline to catch issues early. â€¢ Infrastructure-as-Code: Manage your infrastructure through tools such as Terraform or AWS CloudFormation for repeatable provisioning. â€¢ Monitoring & Alerting: Leverage solutions like Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog, or New Relic to receive real-time insights into application performance and automate the escalation process for issues.3. Pros & Cons of DevOps Automation â€¢ Pros:  â€“ Faster Time to Market: Automated pipelines support rapid releases, helping you deliver new features to customers sooner.  â€“ Reduced Human Error: Scripts and standardized processes minimize manual mistakes and misconfigurations.  â€“ Consistency & Reliability: Reproducible builds and deployments maintain consistent environments across staging and production. â€¢ Cons:  â€“ Initial Setup Complexity: Building automated pipelines requires time, expertise, and alignment on tools and standards.  â€“ Maintenance Overhead: Automation scripts and pipelines need continuous upkeep to accommodate new code, dependencies, and security patches.  â€“ Skill Gaps: Not all team members may be familiar with automation tools; training or hiring specialized talent might be needed.4. Tips for Continuous Improvement â€¢ Review & Update Pipelines: Regularly revisit your pipeline configurations to remove outdated scripts or add new integrations. â€¢ Shift Security Left: Integrate security scans early in the pipeline to detect vulnerabilities before they reach production. â€¢ Embrace Observability: Track key metrics

Day16-16MarchFortune Cloud Technologies Private Limited ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ What is Devops ?---DevOps is a combination of "Development" and "Operations." It's a set of practices, tools, and cultural philosophies aimed at improving the collaboration and communication between software development (Dev) and IT operations (Ops). The goal is to automate and streamline the process of building, testing, releasing, and managing software to deliver faster, more reliable updates and improvements.ğŸ¯ Key Goals of DevOps:âœ… Faster delivery â€“ Automating processes to shorten the software development lifecycle. âœ… Higher quality â€“ Reducing bugs and improving software reliability. âœ… Better collaboration â€“ Breaking down silos between developers and operations teams. âœ… Increased automation â€“ Automating repetitive tasks to reduce errors and increase efficiency. âœ… Continuous improvement â€“ Using feedback to improve processes and products.ğŸŒ Why DevOps Matters1. Faster Delivery: Continuous deployment means you can release code multiple times a day.2. Improved Quality: Automated testing and monitoring catch bugs early.3 .Better Team Collaboration: No more blaming between development and operations teams.4. Cost Reduction: Automation reduces manual effort and human error.5. Scalability: Infrastructure as Code (IaC) allows for rapid scaling.ğŸš€ DevOps Life Cycle (Short Summary)The DevOps lifecycle includes 8 key stages that form a continuous loop:1ï¸âƒ£ Plan â€“ Define project requirements and goals.2ï¸âƒ£ Develop â€“ Write and manage code using version control.3ï¸âƒ£ Build â€“ Compile and package the code.4ï¸âƒ£ Test â€“ Run automated tests to check for bugs and errors.5ï¸âƒ£ Release â€“ Prepare and approve code for deployment.6ï¸âƒ£ Deploy â€“ Automate code deployment to production.7ï¸âƒ£ Operate â€“ Manage and monitor applications and infrastructure.8ï¸âƒ£ Monitor â€“ Continuously track performance and issues.DevOps = Faster Releases + Better Quality + Happier Teams ğŸ˜Fortune Cloud Technologies Private Limitedhashtag#devops hashtag#aws hashtag#docker hashtag#kubernets hashtag#jenkins hashtag#cloud hashtag#tools hashtag#fortunecloud
